channel.title: [317] Delta needa help
channel.description: Hello all, i have a issue with my server, now when ever i try kick someone it nulls them for a short time and me as well, when ever i try to log out, I press the button wait about 5 seconds before it actually logs me out and it nulls me for a short time aswell. i was wondering why?

item.title: [317] Delta needa help
item.dc:creator: @flyer flyer
item.description:
@flyer wrote:

[quote=“Rocky2k10, post:7, topic:364730”][quote author=#Haste link=topic=460935.msg3372161#msg3372161 date=1287323162]

im not using your source so idk whats going on…

Lmfao, you need to find a new kick command or at least try to make one yourself.
Instead of copying someone else’s command, why dont you make one of your own?
[/quote][/quote]

Rocky how can u say that, in the interest of find a better kick command i stumbled on your source which has the exact same kick command.

and if it is my kick commad i will search for a new one but this hasn’t solved my logout issue.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Delta needa help
item.dc:creator: @flyer flyer
item.description:
@flyer wrote:

ok it says AB=9154

in my clicking most 9154 is the log out button of course
this is the case for it.

case 9154: // Log out long currentTime = System.currentTimeMillis(); if (c.inCombat) { c.sM("You must wait until you are out of combat before logging out!"); break; } if(c.action == 1){ c.sM("Suspicious activity!"); break; } // if(c.currentHealth > 0) c.logout();

As for the null when kicking i wasn’t sure what u meant by CMD like if u ment the .bat or the actually CMD in client.java well this is whats under my kick command in client. java

if (command.startsWith("kick") && playerRights > 0) { client noob = null; for(int i = 0; i < server.playerHandler.players.length; i++){ if(server.playerHandler.players[i] != null){ if(command.substring(5).equalsIgnoreCase(server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName)){ noob = (client)server.playerHandler.players[i]; noob.disconnected = true; noob.logoutButton = true; } } } }

Read full topic
